description: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts >= 7.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = A026827(n+6). - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 31 2008G.f.: product_{j=7..infinity} (1+x^j). - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 31 2008
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember;      `if`(n=0, 1, `if`((i-6)*(i+7)/2<n, 0,       add(b(n-i*j, i-1), j=0..min(1, n/i))))    end:a:= n-> b(n$2):seq(a(n), n=0..100);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 07 2014
mathematica: d[n_] := Select[IntegerPartitions[n], Max[Length /@ Split@#] == 1 && Min[#] >= 7 &]; Table[d[n], {n, 20}] (* strict partitions, parts >= 7 *)Table[Length[d[n]], {n, 40}] (* A025152 for n >= 1 *)(* _Clark Kimberling_, Mar 07 2014 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
